answers.answer: Hi,How are you?Microvascular ischemia of the brain is seen as hyperintense foci on MRI. Since high BP has been ruled out other causes like smoking, alcoholism, old age, and diabetes have to be considered.Do you think any of these could be responsible in your case?

question: results of my MRIseveral punctate t2 hyperintense foci are in bilateral subcortical white matter.one of the results was that I have mild chronic small vessel ischemic....in simple termshigh blood pressure.Dr could not give me an explaination because my blood pressure is normal.thank you for your time and efforts on my behalfLinda TrumanThis discussion is related tohttp://www.medhelp.org/posts/show/296604.
title: t2hyperintense foci
